009package Ch11_Circles_Ellipses;
010
011import static imagingbook.common.geometry.fitting.circle.algebraic.CircleFitAlgebraic.FitType.Pratt;
012import static imagingbook.common.geometry.fitting.circle.geometric.CircleFitGeometric.FitType.DistanceBased;
013
014import java.util.Locale;
015
016import ij.IJ;
017import ij.ImagePlus;
018import ij.gui.GenericDialog;
019import ij.gui.Overlay;
020import ij.gui.Roi;
021import ij.plugin.filter.PlugInFilter;
022import ij.process.ImageProcessor;
023import imagingbook.common.color.sets.BasicAwtColor;
024import imagingbook.common.geometry.basic.Pnt2d;
025import imagingbook.common.geometry.circle.GeometricCircle;
026import imagingbook.common.geometry.fitting.circle.algebraic.CircleFitAlgebraic;
027import imagingbook.common.geometry.fitting.circle.geometric.CircleFitGeometric;
028import imagingbook.common.ij.DialogUtils;
029import imagingbook.common.ij.IjUtils;
030import imagingbook.common.ij.RoiUtils;
031import imagingbook.common.ij.overlay.ColoredStroke;
032import imagingbook.common.ij.overlay.ShapeOverlayAdapter;
033
034
035/**
036 * <p>
037 * ImageJ plugin, performs algebraic circle fitting on the current ROI to find
038 * an initial circle, followed by geometric fitting. Algebraic and geometric fitting
039 * methods can be selected (see Sec. 11.1 of [1] for details). If successful,
040 * the resulting ellipses are displayed as a vector overlay (color can be
041 * chosen). Sample points are either collected from the ROI (if available) or
042 * collected as foreground pixels (values &gt; 0) from the image. If no image is
043 * currently open, the user is asked to create a suitable sample image.
044 * </p>
045 * <p>
046 * [1] W. Burger, M.J. Burge, <em>Digital Image Processing &ndash; An
047 * Algorithmic Introduction</em>, 3rd ed, Springer (2022).
048 * </p>
049 * 
050 * @author WB
051 * @version 2022/10/03
052 */
053public class Circle_Fitting implements PlugInFilter {
054        
055        static CircleFitAlgebraic.FitType AlgebraicFitMethod = Pratt;
056        static CircleFitGeometric.FitType GeometricFitMethod = DistanceBased;
057        static boolean UsePointsFromRoi = false;
058        
059        private static BasicAwtColor AlgebraicFitColor = BasicAwtColor.Red;
060        private static BasicAwtColor GeometricFitColor = BasicAwtColor.Blue;
061        private static double StrokeWidth = 0.5;
062        
063        private ImagePlus im;
064        
065        /**
066         * Constructor, asks to open a predefined sample image if no other image
067         * is currently open.
068         */
069        public Circle_Fitting() {
070                if (IjUtils.noCurrentImage()) {
071                        if (DialogUtils.askForSampleImage()) {
072                                IjUtils.run(new Circle_Make_Random()); //runPlugIn(Circle_Make_Random.class);
073                        }                       
074                }
075        }
076
077        
078        @Override
079        public int setup(String arg, ImagePlus im) {
080                this.im = im;
081                return DOES_ALL;
082        }
083
084        @Override
085        public void run(ImageProcessor ip) {
086                Roi roi = im.getRoi();
087                UsePointsFromRoi = (roi != null);
088                
089                if (!runDialog()) {
090                        return;
091                }
092                
093                Pnt2d[] points = (UsePointsFromRoi) ?
094                                RoiUtils.getOutlinePointsFloat(roi) :
095                                IjUtils.collectNonzeroPoints(ip);
096                
097                IJ.log("Found points " + points.length);
098                if (points.length < 3) {
099                        IJ.error("At least 3 points are required, but found only " + points.length);
100                        return;
101                }
102                
103                Overlay oly = im.getOverlay();
104                if (oly == null) {
105                        oly = new Overlay();
106                        im.setOverlay(oly);
107                }       
108                ShapeOverlayAdapter ola = new ShapeOverlayAdapter(oly); 
109                
110                // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
111                CircleFitAlgebraic fitA = CircleFitAlgebraic.getFit(AlgebraicFitMethod, points);
112                // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
113                
114                GeometricCircle ac = fitA.getGeometricCircle();
115                if (ac == null) {
116                        IJ.log("Algebraic fit: no result!");
117                        return;
118                }
119                
120                GeometricCircle initCircle = ac;
121                
122                IJ.log("Initial fit (algebraic):");
123                IJ.log("  circle: " + initCircle.toString());
124                IJ.log(String.format(Locale.US, "  error = %.3f", initCircle.getMeanSquareError(points)));
125                
126                ColoredStroke initialStroke = new ColoredStroke(StrokeWidth, AlgebraicFitColor.getColor());
127                ola.addShapes(initCircle.getShapes(3), initialStroke);
128
129                // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
130                CircleFitGeometric fitG = CircleFitGeometric.getFit(GeometricFitMethod, points, initCircle);
131                // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
132                
133                GeometricCircle finalCircle = fitG.getCircle();
134                if (finalCircle == null) {
135                        IJ.log("Geometric fit: no result!");
136                        return;
137                }
138                
139                IJ.log("Final fit (geometric):");
140                IJ.log("  circle: " + finalCircle.toString());
141                IJ.log(String.format(Locale.US, "  error = %.3f", finalCircle.getMeanSquareError(points)));
142                IJ.log("  iterations = " + fitG.getIterations());
143
144                ColoredStroke finalStroke = new ColoredStroke(StrokeWidth, GeometricFitColor.getColor());
145                ola.addShapes(finalCircle.getShapes(3), finalStroke);
146        }
147
148        // ------------------------------------------
149        
150        private boolean runDialog() {
151                GenericDialog gd = new GenericDialog(this.getClass().getSimpleName());
152                
153                gd.addMessage(DialogUtils.makeLineSeparatedString(
154                                "This plugin performs algebraic + geometric circle fitting,",
155                                "either to ROI points (if available) or foreground points",
156                                "collected from the pixel image."
157                                ));
158                
159                gd.addCheckbox("Use ROI (float) points", UsePointsFromRoi);
160                gd.addEnumChoice("Algebraic fit method", AlgebraicFitMethod);
161                gd.addEnumChoice("Algebraic ellipse color", AlgebraicFitColor);
162                gd.addEnumChoice("Geometric fit method", GeometricFitMethod);
163                gd.addEnumChoice("Geometric ellipse color", GeometricFitColor);
164                
165                gd.showDialog();
166                if (gd.wasCanceled())
167                        return false;
168                
169                UsePointsFromRoi = gd.getNextBoolean();
170                AlgebraicFitMethod = gd.getNextEnumChoice(CircleFitAlgebraic.FitType.class);
171                AlgebraicFitColor = gd.getNextEnumChoice(BasicAwtColor.class);
172                GeometricFitMethod = gd.getNextEnumChoice(CircleFitGeometric.FitType.class);
173                GeometricFitColor = gd.getNextEnumChoice(BasicAwtColor.class);
174                
175                return true;
176        }
177
178
179
180}
